ENGLISH: During the Second World War, the Philippines suffered terrible hardship during the Japanese occupation. Out of this hardship has been born a movement for full independence.
The Philippines are fighting a guerrilla war with communist rebels, should we intervene?
The time has come for our people to take the issue of independence into our own hands.
The Fate of the Hukbalahap Movement

The Hukbalahap Movement is a peasant-led guerrilla communist movement which opposed the Japanese occupation of our country. The time has come to decide how to handle this dangerous faction within our country.
REMOVE HASH FOR ACTIVE EVENTS AND OPTIONS
The people of the Philippines have been asking for greater independence from the United States, how should we respond?
Grant them independence and aid, but retain military access
The government of the Philippines have formally demanded independence from the United States, how should we respond?
Ignore the will of their people, keep them as a puppet!
The Philippines are fighting a guerrilla war with communist rebels, should we intervene?
The benevolent leaders of the United States have today granted us independence!
The United States have granted us independence, but have retained military bases and limited our economic freedom!
The imperialist leaders of the United States have refused to grant independence!
We will continue to seek freedom!
Our government will formally request independence!

The Hukbalahap Movement is a peasant-led guerrilla communist movement which opposed the Japanese occupation of our country. The time has come to decide how to handle this dangerous faction within our country.

Hukbalahap members have ambushed and murdered Aurora Quezon, Chairman of the Philippine Red Cross and widow of the Philippines' second president, Manuel L. Quezon, as she was en route to her hometown for the dedication of the Quezon Memorial Hospital
The US has decided to grant us military aid in our struggle against the Hukbalahap revolt
